name: Marc Benioff
text: The real miracle is not to fly or walk on fire. The real miracle is to walk on the Earth, and you can perform that miracle at any time. Just bring your mind home to your body, become alive, and perform the miracle of walking on Earth. Thich Nhat Hanh | |

name: Marc Benioff
text: Breathe and return to the present moment. This is the miracle of mindfulness. This moment is full of wonders. Mindfulness is a source of happiness. Peace in oneself Peace in the World. The miracle is to walk on earth. Thank you @thichnhathanh @RCPaddock.//t.co/vydrIi30EY

text: Prop C's victory means the homeless will have a home & the help they truly need! Let the city come together in Love for those who need it most! There is no finish line when it come to helping the homeless. Thank you amazing supporters of Prop C!//t.co/0JOXCua1m1

name: Marc Benioff
text: In the richest city in the world, the students in our schools are still homeless. 2,293 children are now experiencing homelessness in San Francisco. How can you study in school if your homeless? Where is the political will to help these mothers & children?//t.co/010QknlURW

name: Marc Benioff
text: Homelessness is up 17% in San Francisco. It's not a surprise to our citizens, but perhaps to those who fought against our one hope to make a major difference: Prop C. The one bright spot is homeless youth thanks to the funding of our Heading Home program.//t.co/kVFk7ph65M

name: Marc Benioff
text: Homelessness remains our city's #1 crisis and must be our #1 priority. We need an all our press on every idea, concept, & notion on how to get every homeless child, family, & adult into a home. We need stay focused on getting our Prop C funds released!//t.co/yciq36JqWO

name: Marc Benioff
text: In October, I announced my plan to open 1,000 new shelter beds by 2020. We've opened 212 to date, and today I'm proposing a new 200-bed SAFE Navigation Center at Seawall Lot 330 to help our homeless residents off the streets and into shelter.//t.co/ihpiawdbsu

name: Marc Benioff
text: It was an honor to share the @60Minutes spotlight on Closing the Gender Gap with women in leadership such as @PlutonForEver or @vkajones, or women-led orgs such as @littlebits (run by the amazing @ayahbdeir) and @MarymountNY (run by Concepcion Alvcar).//t.co/kDPhjhV2vG

name: Marc Benioff
text: I want to call out Alexis Dixon, the 4th grade teacher from Brooklyn who chose to teach CS in her classroom with @codeorg. She represents 1 MILLION teachers, mostly women, who lead the movement for CS in schools. You, ALL of you, are the STARS of this show//t.co/sESuRCdZcB

name: Marc Benioff
text: @Deirdre206 @exploringcs @groklearning @hilarydito @hklageman @jancuny @janebroom @JocelynLeavitt @karliekloss @KathySurd @kellymgaier @khanacademy @lsudol @MauryaCouvares @mckalyn @melsariffodeen @MoniqueMRice @mretamal @ncwit @physnicks @reshmasaujani @sleuthacademy

name: Marc Benioff
text: @somegoodideas @SReberry @stateofrelate @superCompSci @szircher @TaraChk @tina_granato @vidcode @VTSikka @6Gems All these women and more (including many I couldn't find on Twitter), and the men who work alongside you as allies, are together changing the face of computing.

name: Marc Benioff
text: And a list like this wouldn't be fair without mentioning the women who RUN @codeorg, especially @AliceSteinglass, our President, who deserves far more attention than she receives for her incredible work. It's a joy to work in an office whose staff and leadership are mostly women.

name: Marc Benioff
text: On a personal note, my mother, Farideh, an Iranian computer scientist who showed me my first mainframe computer when I was 5, has been behind me and my twin + co-founder @apartovi at every step. Farideh is so very proud of her twins today. Happy #WomensHistoryMonth to all.

name: Marc Benioff
text: The global movement for equitable access and participation in CS is possible thanks to the work of hundreds of organizational leaders, most of whom are women. To name just a few: @adafruit @ActuaCEO @alaina @amy_werst @AnnikaOP @beckano @BeMalhot @BrendaDardenW @dahlbys

name: Marc Benioff
text: Wild irony that women keep getting written out of the story about how we are leading efforts to increase women representation, power, ownership in every field. We've had similar experiences at @HashtagAngels for work on #TheGapTable and the like. You've got to be kidding me.//t.co/MTTd1Icy2J

name: Marc Benioff
text: huge props to @GirlsWhoCode, @BlackGirlsCode, @HashtagAngels the many great orgs who are helping get girls and women into tech and vc. Writing women out of history is a solveable problem.//t.co/vQiZAQ3d88

name: Marc Benioff
text: I did watch and @60Minutes segment on coding and the gender gap was...interesting. Indeed especially since it left out the contributions of female-led orgs who've done ALL of the heaving lifting in this space.//t.co/qSD6OrkwKS

name: Marc Benioff
text: "Viewers saw a man presented as a savior of women and girls (ironically w/ the help of some of @GirlsWhoCode's research). It was patently ridiculous to see the network uplift a man as the leader of a movement to get more women into tech." @reshmasaujani //t.co/PAxEHZ30BU

name: Marc Benioff
text: Excluding Girls Who Code from a story about closing the gender gap in tech is worse than bad journalism, it's a punch in the gut. Read @reshmasaujani's response to @60Minutes //t.co/zhMWzQA10D

name: Marc Benioff
text: y'all successfully took a segment that could have highlighted the hard work women have done in this field and gave it to a man. This literally happens to real female engineers in the workforce and you guys managed to re-create while trying to address the gender-gap topic. Tragic//t.co/jz9XZwRjWW

name: Marc Benioff
text: In the U.S., there are a half a million open computing jobs, but qualified candidates for them are overwhelmingly male. One group is tryingand succeedingto attract women to tech.//t.co/y5AgjjTJcW//t.co/QGNVueYOEN

name: Marc Benioff
text: .@60Minutes producers filmed this @GirlsWhoCode club at @ps354q in Jamaica Queens & decided these brilliant, determined girls didn't have a place in their story. We disagree. We have 6,000 clubs like this one in 50 states #ReadyForOurCloseUp//t.co/lSGGjoxbC4

name: Marc Benioff
text: Never thought bravery would mean calling out @60minutes but here I am. They just aired a segment on the gender gap in tech without mentioning @GirlsWhoCode or any women orgs. Girls, this one's for you. #bravenotperfect //t.co/n1nDaLS7xA

name: Marc Benioff
text: A powerful @60Minutes featuring @hadip @codeorg on how to increase women in technology. We must to listen to @GirlsWhoCode & other women's voices in making this happen. From 60 Minutes: Closing the gender gap in the tech industry//t.co/peihFF9TX4

name: Marc Benioff
text: By omitting the expertise and experience of woman-led organizations pioneering efforts to bring more girls into computing, @60Minutes is contributing to a long and ugly history of media erasing women in tech. @GirlsWhoCode //t.co/4yP2DCHTrn
